intro: Loasa poissoniana, commonly known as the golden loasa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Loasa poissoniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and hardy nature.
